summary: The term "private equity investment fund" refers to a specialized financial institution that pools capital from accredited investors to acquire equity ownership in private companies. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, these funds are primarily governed by the Alternative Investment Fund Managers Directive (AIFMD), which establishes a comprehensive regulatory regime aimed at enhancing transparency and investor protection. As a redirect to the preferred term "private equity," this concept underscores the significance of private equity in fostering innovation and economic growth within the EU. Regulatory compliance ensures that these funds operate within the legal parameters, safeguarding investor interests while promoting market stability.
